channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Go: No Singapore trip for Duterte
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Sen. Bong Go has dismissed reports claiming that President Duterte was airlifted from Davao City to Singapore over the weekend due to a medical emergency.

item.title: Motorcycle barriers no longer needed for backriding
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: As restrictions ease on motorcycle backriding, the Department of the Interior and Local Government reminded the public that the government will still not allow the resumption of motorcycle-taxi services yet.

item.title: P1.2 billion USAID program for Pinoy youth launched
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The United States Agency for International Development has allocated $37.5 million or an estimated P1.2 billion for a five-year program for out-of-school and unemployed Filipino youth.

item.title: ‘No more backlogs in COVID-19 test results’
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health announced yesterday that it is now providing “real-time” data on coronavirus cases since the agency had already emptied the backlogs in test results.

item.title: 27th petition filed vs Anti-Terror Law
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: Sangguniang Kabataan officials from various parts of the country yesterday joined the call for the Supreme Court to declare null and void the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 or ATA.

item.title: ‘48% of COVID-19 fatalities never hospitalized’
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Nearly half of the persons who died of coronavirus disease 2019 were never admitted to hospital or medical facilities, according to data from the Department of Health.

item.title: DOH studying Israeli saliva test for COVID-19
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Israel’s saliva test is now among the test methods for COVID-19 being studied by the Department of Health, an official said yesterday.

item.title: Bicam OKs P166.5 billion for Bayanihan 2
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The bicameral conference committee of the Senate and House of Representatives has agreed to increase funding for the proposed Bayanihan to Recover as One Act or the Bayanihan 2 Law to P166.5 billion amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: ‘Duque still has Duterte’s trust’
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Malacañang remains unmoved by accusations that Health Secretary Francisco Duque III is the “godfather” of an alleged “mafia” in the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. , which is the subject of congressional inquiries.

item.title: 13 PhilHealth execs suspended for 6 months
item.author: Elizabeth Marcelo
item.description: The Office of the Ombudsman has ordered the six-month suspension of 13 officials of the Philippine Health Insurance Corp., amid the ongoing investigation on the alleged massive corruption in the state-run insurer.
